Uses of Class
number.BigNumBinary

  • Uses of BigNumBinary in number

    Fields in number declared as BigNumBinary
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.MGY_N
    Constant BigNumBinary N for Montgomery Multiplication
    static BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.MGY_R
    Constant BigNumber R = 2¹⁰²⁵ for Montgomery Multiplication
    static BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.MGY_R2modN
    Constant BigNumber R² mod N for Montgomery Multiplication
    static BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.MGY_V
    Constant BigNumber V for Montgomery Multiplication
    static BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.ONE
    The BigNumBinary constant One
    static BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.ZERO
    The BigNumBinary constant Zero
    Methods in number that return BigNumBinary
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.add​(BigNumBinary bg)
    Returns a BigNumBinary whose value is this + bg
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.getLower​(int n)
    Return a new BigNumBinary representing the lower half of this Used for Karatsuba
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.getUpper​(int n)
    Return a new BigNumBinary representing the upper half of this Used for Karatsuba
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.mod2p1025()
    Return a new BigNumBinary
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.montgomeryOperator​(BigNumBinary b, BigNumBinary N, BigNumBinary R, BigNumBinary V)
    Calculate this montgomeryOperator b = this.b.r^-1 mod N
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.multiMontgomery​(BigNumBinary b)
    Montgomery Multiplication of this with b Used for performance enhancement Algorithm : Let c = a.b mod N with a,b,N 1024 bits, and C its Montgomery representation Pick R = 10^k with 10^(k-1) <= N <= 10^k Let V = - N^(-1) mod R Let A and B be the Montgomery representations of a and b as this : A = a.R mod N = A montgomeryOperator R² mod N B = b.R mod N = B montgomeryOperator R² mod N C = A montgomeryOperator B Finally, c = a.b mod N = C montgomeryOperator 1 /!\ N,R,V and R² mod have a precalculated value !!
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.multiply​(BigNumBinary p)
    Return a new BigNumBinary equals to this * p "Grade School" Algorithm Need to finish to implement Karatsuba to optimize time execution
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.pow​(BigNumBinary k)
    Return a new BigNumBinary equals to this^k mod N
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.productKaratsuba​(BigNumBinary p)
    (Not Operational yet) Returns a BigNumBinary whose value is this * product "Grade School" Algorithm
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.shiftLeft​(int n)
    Return a new BigNumBinary equals this << n
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.shiftRight​(int n)
    Return a new BigNumBinary
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.squareAndMultiply​(BigNumBinary k)
    Return this^k mod N Note : this must have its Montgomery Representation This condition is not checked !
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.substract​(BigNumBinary little)
    Returns a BigNumBinary whose value is the max(this,little) - min(this,little)

    Get the lowest bit set to 1
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.montgomeryOperator​(BigNumBinary b, BigNumBinary N, BigNumBinary R, BigNumBinary V)
    Calculate this montgomeryOperator b = this.b.r^-1 mod N
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.multiMontgomery​(BigNumBinary b)
    Montgomery Multiplication of this with b Used for performance enhancement Algorithm : Let c = a.b mod N with a,b,N 1024 bits, and C its Montgomery representation Pick R = 10^k with 10^(k-1) <= N <= 10^k Let V = - N^(-1) mod R Let A and B be the Montgomery representations of a and b as this : A = a.R mod N = A montgomeryOperator R² mod N B = b.R mod N = B montgomeryOperator R² mod N C = A montgomeryOperator B Finally, c = a.b mod N = C montgomeryOperator 1 /!\ N,R,V and R² mod have a precalculated value !!
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.multiply​(BigNumBinary p)
    Return a new BigNumBinary equals to this * p "Grade School" Algorithm Need to finish to implement Karatsuba to optimize time execution
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.pow​(BigNumBinary k)
    Return a new BigNumBinary equals to this^k mod N
    BigNumBinary BigNumBinary.productKaratsuba​(BigNumBinary p)
    (Not Operational yet) Returns a BigNumBinary whose value is this * product "Grade School" Algorithm
